attributes.action: Put The Open Golf Championship back on free to air TV
attributes.background: This is the first time in 60 years The Open as not been broadcast on free to air TV. Signing the petition will help influence the government to make The Open Championship a group A protected listed sporting event. Live coverage of the event will then be offered to free to air broadcasters.
attributes.additional_details: The Open Championship dates back to 1860 and is the the world's most prestigious golf tournament and one of four golf majors. With the an international field of the world's best golfers competing for the top prize in golf. The coverage of The Open as been enjoyed by millions on the BBC for the last 60 years, inspiring viewers of all ages to go out and play golf. As a nation we should be proud to host this event and it should be celebrated as one of the great British sporting events.

attributes.action: Bring back national service
attributes.background: So the nation is ready for an unexpected attack or overseas war, also it would help to mold younger people to be more patriotic and proud of our great nation, it also teaches great life skills such as respect, team work, and patriotism and how to help ones self,
attributes.additional_details:
The older generation always say it should be brought back as it didn't do them any harm, 

also it would help against crime that the youth of today get involved in also the new threat of radicalization in the unhappy or troubled members of younger society the ones who think they are useless and have no calling in life, at least national service would unstil a sense of purpose,

attributes.action: Always send users of Class A substances such as heroin to rehab, not jail
attributes.background: Due to the horrific nature of addiction when it comes to substances such as Heroin and Crack cocaine I believe we should be giving users as much help as possible. These people need treatment, not punishment. Making it harder for them to get a job is also less likely to get them off these substances.

attributes.action: Force a review of Great Northern Rail  ( Govia) franchise
attributes.background: Great Northern Railways service has declined significantly since Govia won the franchise. The amount of cancellations is unacceptable on the service, delays and impact on paying customers getting to work and around London is severe.
attributes.additional_details: The cancellation logs for Great Northern should be made available for public viewing, the responses from their social media teams inadequate. Fares continue to rise with no improvement

attributes.action: Install Average Speed Cameras the entire length of the A34 in Oxfordshire
attributes.background:
As reported on national news the A34 has had over 50 deaths in the last 5 years, a significant factor being excessive speed.
There have been calls to reduce the speed limit to 50mph, but regardless of this - there must be robust enforcement, which only a full Average Speed Camera system can achieve
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-36750468

attributes.action: Reverse the agreement for the MOD to purchse helicopters from the USA
attributes.background: The UK helicopter manufacturers have a fantastic track record and in the present economic uncertainty of the UK it would be wrong to award the new fleet to US manufacturers.  The UK has proved over many many years that they could fulfil the MODs requirements.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from the outside lane.
attributes.background: Heavy goods vehicles in the outside lane are a danger to other road users as well as causing huge backlogs of traffic while they attempt overtaking moves at little more than the speed of the vehicle in the inside lane.Cars only in the outside lane please
attributes.additional_details: Last week when leaving Felixstowe docks on the A14 I followed a heavy goods vehicle for 15 miles in the outside lane while they attempted to overtake another HGV which was in the inside lane. A huge queue of cars had built up behind me as the trucks rolled on side by side at virtually identical speed. Very frustrating for other motorists and also dangerous. These heavy vehicles with restricted speed limit should stay in the inside lane at all times

attributes.action: Terrorism: victim family members to be invited on independent commission.
attributes.background: When acts of terrorism occur, victim family members should be given the opportunity to be part of an independent commission (funded by the UK government), to ensure there is a full & proper investigation into the death of their loved ones.

attributes.action: Call a General Election once the new Conservative leader has been selected.
attributes.background: The EU referendum result has left the current government with no backup plan. This petition therefore asks for a General Election to be called so that the parties can set out their positions with regard to EU negotiations. The new government can then go forward with a new mandate and clear plans.
attributes.additional_details: For better or worse, if the UK leaves the EU, we will be entering an unfamiliar economic and diplomatic landscape. A General Election would give the nation an opportunity to debate the implications of the vote and our place in the world. It may not be legally required but, given the vast implications of the referendum result, a General Election is surely a moral and democratic necessity. The future direction of the whole country should not be decided by the members of any single political party.

attributes.action: Put an end to the driving theory process.
attributes.background: The driving theory test that is required in the UK is a complete nonsense. It wasn't deemed necessary in former years and it shouldn't be relevant now. Why should a memory test dictate whether you are suitable to drive? It is simply a money making scheme, which is highly unfair on young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Problems:
- Memory based.
- Favours those who prefer exams conditions.
- It keeps competent young drivers off the roads.
- It drains the money of millions of young people
- It wasn't deemed important years ago so why is it important now?

attributes.action: Make unsecured debt remedies available for child support arrears.
attributes.background: According to Gingerbread, the CSA has left almost £4bn of outstanding arrears, with the DWP’s estimating only £467m is ever likely to be recovered.
attributes.additional_details: According to Gingerbread's latest report, www.gingerbread.org.uk/content/2297/Missing-maintenance nearly half of single-parent families live below the poverty line and the number is increasing. Although the CMS charges for collection, it has only recovered 53% due (leaving£52.5m arrears) and less than half the eligible children getting anything. Its collection remedies are insufficient, particularly for the large number of self-employed/cash- in- hand owing parents.

attributes.action: If a petition gets 250,000 signatures, it should trigger a national referendum
attributes.background:
Engagement with politics is continuing to decline. Direct democracy is part of the solution. 

When an official petition receives around 250,000 signatures, it should result in an official, binding referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland, when around 0.6% of the population signs a petition, it triggers a referendum (https://www.ch.ch/en/referendum/). This system works well in a country of more than eight million people, and there is no reason why it wouldn't work well in the UK.

A committee or group should be set up to administer these petitions so they do not needlessly consume government time. Note that only a small number of petitions a year would receive the needed signatures.

attributes.action: Make Friday a Half working day
attributes.background: Gives everyone a longer weekend. People will be happier and less stressed.

attributes.action: In 2018 hold a referendum on whether negotiated EU Exit terms are acceptable.
attributes.background:
Suggested:
The UK will shortly be leaving the European Union; How should the UK continue trading with the EU? 
1. Trade on the terms of the draft Exit treaty  between the UK and EU? 
2. Trade with the EU only on World Trade Organization rules, until a better Trade Agreement with the EU is agreed?
attributes.additional_details:
This new referendum will seek to ensure that the will of the majority that voted to LEAVE is not watered down by weak UK negotiators who, to gain free trade arrangements, might give away the control of free-movement-of-labour that was voted for. 

Or secondly if the EU is dogmatic and unwilling to include UK control of movement-of-labour this vote effectively gives those who voted to REMAIN  a second referendum.

attributes.action: Britain should apply to become the 51st state of the United States of America
attributes.background: In light of the result of the EU Referendum held on Thursday 23 June and the immediate concomitant decline in the UK economy, it would be germain to enter into a stronger economic union with the United States of America at the earliest possible opportunity.
attributes.additional_details: Under Article IV, Section 3, of the US Constitution, any territory may apply to Congress to join the United States. As the 51st US state, Great Britain would gain all the economic and military backing of the US federal government whilst also being free to draft its own state constitution and effectively retain its sovereignty. This would have the added advantage of allowing the UK Government to invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty sooner than October in order to re-stabilise the EU economy.

attributes.action: Ensure the police can protect minority groups while the Brexit talks take place
attributes.background: In light of the recent increase in racist attacks in the immediate aftermath of the Brexit vote, we call on the government to condemn these attacks in the strongest language and ensure that the police have the resources to protect all our minority populations during the Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Make Imperial Units legal for trade and mandatory alongside Metric Units.
attributes.background: Due to a change in Britain's EU status, make it legal to trade in Imperial Units again and also mandatory to have Imperial Units alongside any existing Metric Units.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of the British public would still prefer to use Imperial Units (Oz, Lbs, Inch, Foot, °F) but European Parliament made it illegal to trade in Imperial Units back in 2000. Due to a change in Great Britain's status in the EU many people would like the right to trade in Imperial Units and also have food packaging etc labelled in duel Units (Metric and Imperial) this is in the interests of everybody as many like to use Metric and many like to use Imperial

attributes.action: 2nd referendum for 16-50 year olds
attributes.background: Almost two thirds of over 60s voted in favour of Brexit and those under 49 voted to remain (according to advance polling). Three quarters of people aged 18-24 voted to remain. It is not fair that the older generation have dominated a large percentage of votes and decided the future for the young.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from Buzzfeed article: https://www.buzzfeed.com/patricksmith/young-people-are-angry-at-old-people-for-voting-leave?utm_term=.eo43KzXBMe#.eo43KzXBMe

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons in Secondary Schools optional
attributes.background: Pupils in Secondary schools are being forced to take part in swimming lessons, being told it 'isn't optional', despite most children being taught how to swim in Primary school. Adolescents should be given the choice whether they want to swim or not, as some are not comfortable doing so.
attributes.additional_details: Older children are being forced to wear swimming costumes and swim in a group with their peers, which can often cause distress, particularly to adolescents having their period who may be forced to wear tampons, or those not comfortable with wearing such clothing in front of others.

attributes.action: We would like to propose that May 1st be officially recognised as Union Day.
attributes.background: On the 1st May 1707 Parliament officially recognised the union of Great Britain
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acts_of_Union_1707

attributes.action: Give the right to children to argue their case in schools
attributes.background: In schools, teachers have complete over-riding control over what children say. If they are falsely accused of doing something which they believe they have not done, or they do not believe they do not deserve a certain punishment, it is labelled as "talking back."
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition to allow children to be able to freely argue their case with a neutral member of staff present in order to make sure that they receive a fair sanction. I have witnessed cases of children not being listened to and having to email the teacher to be heard. Sign for your child's rights.

attributes.action: To have the 23rd June declared an official day of mourning.
attributes.background: To demonstrate to the people who voted us out of the European Union, that we do not consider the 23rd June a cause for celebration.
attributes.additional_details: To be taken out of the European Union is an extremely serious step with catastrophic consequences and there are at least 16 million people who agree with me.  We are not going to be forced to make this move without some form of protest at the least.

attributes.action: To form a UK sterling trade area
attributes.background:
The formation of a sterling trade area comprising England and Wales, an independent Scotland and a united Ireland has the 
 potential to resolve almost all issues of sovereignty, currency, trade agreements following the Brexit decision

attributes.action: Open The United Kingdom's borders for free trade with everyone in the world.
attributes.background: Further to the EU Referendum which voted for The United Kingdom to leave the European Union, I propose that we open our borders for the free movement of goods to and from anywhere in the world.

attributes.action: Deputy Prime minister post alongside Primeminister & one of them must be a woman
attributes.background: According to 2011 census the UK population was estimated 31 million men and 32.2 million women. By a women in such a key post by law will bring equality and fairness in politics and businesses - women think, work and decide differently - having women's contribution will enhance government polices.
attributes.additional_details: Out of 650 MPs there are 191 women although their representation is improving, they are still often a long way from getting to the highest posts. Studies at Stanford US and University of Chicago have found that districts served by female legislators are at a distinct advantage over those represented by men. Women are actually more inclined towards more modern leadership, which is collaborative problem-solving, enabling, consultative, and not just trying to assert a kind of hierarchical power.

attributes.action: Allow the registration of 15 year olds, enabling them eligibility to vote at 16
attributes.background: Young people should be allowed to vote in all local and national elections and referendums. During the recent European referendum, an increasing amount of younger people were voicing frustration at not being allowed to take part in the democratic process.
attributes.additional_details: Younger people are becoming increasingly interested in politics at a local, national and global level. It seems unfair that people under 18 should be excluded from a process that has implications on their lives and shapes their long term future. I am calling on the UK parliament to extend the right to vote to all 16 year olds. While recently campaigning, talking to young people indicated to me that they are showing a real enthusiasm and interest in how politics affects their lives.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship automatically to foreign parents of British children
attributes.background:
I am Hungarian, business owner, property owner, a UK resident, have 2 British children, born in the UK.
I want the government to give me and other parents a guarantee, that after leaving the EU, I will have the right to remain, with my family by giving citizenship to parents like me, automatically.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against homeless people a lawfully recognised hate crime
attributes.background: A hate crime is defined in British law as an act of violence or hostility directed at someone because of who they are yet homeless people are not covered by this law. We want new legislation to further prosecute people who commit hate crimes against homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: One year 52% of homeless people suffered from violence (Source: Crisis). Whilst this in itself is a criminal offence it is not further punishable under the Criminal Justice Act 2003. We would also like to have police support and advice to be more widely available for homeless people. Many homeless people are afraid to report incidents to police and we would like change this.

attributes.action: Begin a UK Space Program
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU, which means the ESA (European Space Agency) will no longer be the go-to for UK citizens interested in space.
Form a UK Space Program so that the UK may participate in the advancement of space related science and exploration.

attributes.action: A new ONS prevalence survey into Children's and Young People's Mental Health.
attributes.background: Office of National Statistics prevalence surveys were carried out into Children and Young People's Mental Health in 1999 & 2004.  We have no equivalent up to date information.  There are indicators of a growing problem in the UK in this area.  A new survey would highlight the need for action.
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons Health Committee, "Children's and Adolescent's mental health and CAMHS: Third Report of Session 2014-15", p17, http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmhealth/342/342.pdf
Chief Medical Officer, "Annual Report 2012: Our Children Deserve Better", ch10 p3, https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/255237/2901304_CMO_complete_low_res_accessible.pdf

attributes.action: Ban teaching children under 16 religion
attributes.background: Leaders of religious and faith based groups raise money from supporters on an unproven pretext. In any sphere of life this amounts to fraud.
attributes.additional_details: No faith based teaching should be allowed to be given to children under the age of 16. The concept of a external superior force or being is so incredible that children need early indoctrination for the idea to take hold. It is unlikely that given free will an individual would arrive at the idea that our actions our guided by an unearthly force.

attributes.action: Oppose changes to make you pay full market rent on your council home.
attributes.background: A Government Housing and Planning Bill will see people even on modest incomes threatened with the prospect of paying full market rent in their council and housing association homes (http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN06804/SN06804.pdf).
attributes.additional_details: Ending secure council tenancies means the government is legislating to deny families a stable home.

attributes.action: UK public to be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.background: The UK public elect its most influential people, Prime Minister, Chancellor, Home Secretary, Lord Mayor etc as a democracy. The UK public should also be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.additional_details: The Governor of the Bank of England directly has control over the UK debt, availability of homes, interest rates. The governor also needs to have measurable objectives that his performance can be directly assessed.

attributes.action: NOT to allow Bailiffs to enter property unless accompanied by a police officer
attributes.background: Many people today experience violent and aggressive bailiffs. To avoid assault and humiliating threats, a police officer should attend entry to any property avoiding potential physical harm to the house holder and others to remove all threats of violence or intimidation.
attributes.additional_details: That the bailiff focus on the collection procedure showing respect and non violent means using reasonable behaviour at all times.

attributes.action: NHS to employ more Psychiatrists so patients are able to have a proper diagnosis
attributes.background: How is someone able to get better without a proper diagnosis? I believe if I had been diagnosed earlier then I would be now employed and become a productive member of society.
attributes.additional_details:
My doctor and I have continually requested a consultation with the NHS for an assessment with a psychiatrist for a duration of three years.  
The government is committed to mental health care mainly targeting dementia and teenagers.  What I propose covers everyone, all genders, races and financial backgrounds.  
The treatment I have received had really upset me and frustrated my GP, friends and family who are also affected by the condition I have. Everyone should have the right to a proper diagnosis and so the required treatment can be undertaken.

attributes.action: End the PrePay RipOff. Prepay fuel bills cost £226 a year more than direct debit
attributes.background: According to the Citizens Advice Bureau prepayment meter consumers pay £226 a year more than those who use direct debit, yet these consumers are often the poorest in our society.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to require energy companies to:
1. Cut the cost of prepayment meters in line with the cheapest direct debit fuel tariffs saving consumers £226 a year
2. End debt collection by energy companies during the winter (as Scottish Energy have done)
3. Ensure homes with pensioners, disabled people and children don't have prepayment meters fitted 
4. Stop installation of prepayment meters during the winter 
5. Protect prepayment customers from disconnection as smart meters are introduced across the UK by 2020.

attributes.action: Change E.S.A back to Incapacity benefit
attributes.background: I believe the current policies regarding ESA are wrong and unreasonable to the extent that the long term sick, are sick and not able to work, the decision to put the sick into work makes no sense as the illnesses are still there and there is no work for long term sufferers.

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/

attributes.action: All new public transport buses to be either electric or hydrogen fuel by 2018.
attributes.background: Health campaigners say Britain is facing an “air pollution crisis”.  It is estimated that the lives of 40,000 to 50,000 people in the UK are ended prematurely every year.  Yet technology exists to solve this problem.  By introducing new zero emission buses, dirty diesel buses will be phased out.

attributes.action: Remove the law that states you must stay in education until you are 18.
attributes.background: In England, you must stay in some form of education until you are 18 years old. I believe this is wrong, as it limits the choice of young people. If this law was removed, everyone would have the ability to do what they want to do after they leave school.
attributes.additional_details: As a college student myself, I understand how many people who are 16 or 17 years old feel. I believe at this age we lack rights. We don't have the right to vote, and we don't have the right to make a choice on our own futures. I feel for many, attending college isn't the right choice, and unless we are able to secure an Apprenticeship, there is no way for us to leave. Personally I find remaining at college difficult, as I would like to seek full time employment, but that choice isn't available.

attributes.action: Make inappropriate/unwanted sexual pictures fall under the indecent exposure law
attributes.background:
Most women are subjected to unwanted sexual/inappropriate pictures from men usually of their penis on most social networking sites or phone apps
I feel this should fall under the indecent exposure laws

attributes.action: Make all school 'inset days' during 'half term' periods, to save childcare cost.
attributes.background: Schools in the UK typically have 6 holiday periods per year. During this time, many parents need to pay for additional childcare or take time off work. In addition to this, schools also take many add hoc inset days (teacher training days). This training should be done during half term periods.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools doing their training during the half term periods, would save millions of parents time, money and inconvenience. It's extremely difficult for full time working parents to accommodate those ad hoc days, when the school is closed to pupils. 

The school building should be utilised during the half term periods for teacher training, as this is not only convenient for parents, but would be a better use of the school facilities, many of which are paid for with public tax money.

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: Raise pay for regular and reserve armed forces personnel
attributes.background: Our armed forces are underpaid and over worked we think that there minimum pay should be raised not just for regulars but also reserve units aswell
attributes.additional_details: I am an ex regular soldier and a serving reserve soldier in the army and I've seen first hand the state some of my muckers have been in having to budget for everything while risking there life if needs must to protect the uk and her inhabitants

attributes.action: Begin phasing out the sale of new fossil-fuel powered cars by 2018
attributes.background: Although by no means the only cause of air pollution, there is an opportunity to make inroads into NOx emissions by the gradual phasing-out of fossil-fuel powered cars, commencing with banning company car fleets from purchasing anything other than fully electric vehicles by 2018.
attributes.additional_details: Then, sales of private non-electric-powered cars must be prohibited by 2025.  Obviously, this must be supported by additional scrappage schemes to help those who must buy cars to meet the additional costs of electric vehicles AND (more importantly), massively increased investment in public transport but by starting with fleets, this will mean the first phase of eliminating fossil fuel powered cars will by carried out by those best placed to absorb the costs - i.e. large businesses

attributes.action: Ban all-metal manhole covers on roads
attributes.background: Having ridden motorcycles for a number or years, I have had many encounters with slippery manhole covers on roads, especially while cornering.  The change in surface grip leads to the wheels of the vehicle slipping, potentially causing serious consequences.
attributes.additional_details: There are two practical solutions; either replace the manhole covers with a non-metallic material or coating existing covers with a higher grip material.

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Make Makaton sign language part of the national curriculum and the EYFS
attributes.background: Makaton is a form of sign language used by many people with hearing or speech disabilities, if Makaton was taught from a young age signing would become as natural as learning your first language. If everyone could sign it would break down barriers, for people with disabilities and unite people.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy on the use of fireworks in the UK.
attributes.background: Following a recent petition calling for a ban and the official response, to further obtain public opinion on the misuse of fireworks. Government to fund research into the impact on human and animal health and well being to be the primary aim of the research.
